Reviews.Title: “Stayed here in 2009, great staff, and a friendly manager!”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap place to stay for my conference in 2009 in San Diego. This was the cheapest place I could find. It is close to the airport and after traveling for 16 hours from Amsterdam, The Netherlands that was a welcome relief. The staff was courteous and the rooms spotless. I remember the manager gave me a week pass to all the attractions in San Diego because some customer left them with her. The laundry machines in the back are powerful and cheaply priced. I stayed 10 days and it was a pleasure. The down town area is close by as is the gas lamp district. And there is a large grocery store nearby, I think it is called Ralph's. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously getting the run around”
Reviews.Author: Danny R
Reviews.Content: On two occasions, I have replied to posts made on sites such as Craigslist when the hotel advertising Weekly rates. Naturally, one would assume that this would mean that there is at least one unit open and available for that promotion, right? But no. All they have is one or two rooms available for a night - possibly two. And of course, they're available at the standard rate - which is never published anywhere - not their own web site nor that of any other hotel search engine. The list 'bait & switch' scheme is to get people who need temporary accommodations to call and stay at the regular room rate cause a "weekly room" will be opening up in just a couple of days. I had hoped that the place had improved since a friend of mine stayed there last year, but they are the "Used Car salesman" that creepy feeling you get in the back of your head is trying to warn you about.

Reviews.Title: “"This Hotel Needs Revamping of Staff and Management"”
Reviews.Author: chanel49
Reviews.Content: Please shut this hotel down. Bedbugs,an occasional rat,mold in the bathroom area, and a rude staff and manager. Illegal use of credit cards. No deposit back that was payed for when checking in and no refund when kicked out(accused of messy room and smell) with prepayed 2 weeks in advance. Disputing American Express Card charges. Contacted the BBB and the Health Department of San Diego. Look for more disturbing reviews on Yelp.com.

Reviews.Title: “I am a Victim of Identity Theft Hotel Management”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: On September 10th at 10am a front desk employee of the Hotel Occidental, used my credit card information, billing address and identity to make online purchases without my consent The goods were being shipped to Amalia (Maly) a front desk employee at the Occidental address. I was a guest of this hotel and this is where the individual obtained my information. I have filed a reports with the local police, the City Attorney, District Attorney, Better Business Bureau, the Secretary of State and the FTC. They need to be investigated and possibly SHUT DOWN! I have attempted to speak with the manager Jeremy of this hotel and he was very rude, abrasive, unprofessional and hung up the phone in mid conversation. Once the investigation is complete, I will be pressing charges against the individual and the hotel. BEWARE! They may be doing this to other guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for college students on vacation or doing an internship!”
Reviews.Author: mandabearrx
Reviews.Content: I came to San Diego for an internship for 2 months. After searching for a hotel that would be in my price range I came upon Hotel Occidental. It is a lot like a dorm building which I would only recommend for people who are young or adults who don't mind sharing a bathroom and shower. I paid 160 every week with an extra 25 bucks for my boyfriend to be a guest. Parking is a pain in the butt until you wait for the meters to be free. They offer parking in the hotel but it is very limited. I suggest you bring a pillow because the ones in my room were horribly flat. The hotel does offer internet which only had a few random issues during my stay. I enjoyed that the bus i had to take to get to my internship in Hillcrest was two blocks away. I wouldn't suggest walking around here at night alone but it's certainly not the most dangerous area i've ever seen. There is a password code for the entrance door which makes me feel safe except when other guests of the hotel let random strangers who didn't live here in the door. There was a homeless person sleeping in the lobby all night long! As for the kitchenette, you basically wash your face and brush your teeth in the same sink that you wash dishes in. it was a little difficult to prepare my meals in the microwave but I managed fairly well. I just wish that the mini fridge has a better freezer section. i couldnt have frozen goods which made it harder to spend less on eating out. The manager and all the other employees were pretty nice and I never had any issues with them. All in all I will gladly stay at this hotel again and I plan on it in december.

Reviews.Title: “Sold my prepaid three night room and greeted with apathy”
Reviews.Author: 6BQ
Reviews.Content: prepaid a month before. Showed up and they were unapologicically full at 5PM wednesday 2/16/11. No apology. Guy at desk didn't care. No help in finding someplace else and not answering phone for 5 days during business hours when trying to arrange refund. The place looked cool. When they go out of business and someone who cares a little about the customer buys it, it may be worth looking into. STAY AWAY until the place goes out of business--and it will based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, bedbags”
Reviews.Author: benymiller
Reviews.Content: Infected of fleas and thumbtacks, bedbags infected. The people of receipt know the problem and nevertheless it rents the rooms. Hotel to demand

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bedbugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GED09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel occidental and had a horrible infestation of bedbugs. We were just staying while waiting to move in to our new home and it was horrible. Be careful and make sure they have completely eliminated the problem...bedbugs are very insidious and hard to get rid of.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Accidental”
Reviews.Author: SleepySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Terrible service. Very noisy. Drug activity is in the building. You would be a fool to stay there. Management is also clueless. The Island Inn or the J Street Inn are better locations.

Reviews.Title: “European style budget hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: jdavies2001
Reviews.Content: OK, first things first, this is not a luxury hotel and does not charge luxury prices. It has small rooms and I can image the average American would be horrified by the limited room space. However, if you've stayed in economy hotels in places like London, Paris or Amsterdam then you wont be shocked and it was comfortable (and we had a two year old in with us). The hotel has character and its a lovely old building. The location is pretty good, town centre is walkable as is the park with all its museums (the zoo is amazing). Staff helpful and friendly, free DVDs are available from reception and the breakfast was good. Also found free parking on street outside. With regard to the previous review that claimed its in a run down area, that the hotel has prostitutes and that its not safe for families - well all I can say is that I disagree with all three statements! We walked down to Italian area of city (about 10 mins) and had a lovely meal and walked back, all with our toddler in a pushchair and felt perfectly safe.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: bonzaiWashington
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a run down area of the city. I definitely did not feel safe walking the streets at night. Also, a young woman was running an illegal service in the room next to mine. A lacrosse team was staying at the hotel and I think the entire team was visiting this womans room. Not a family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great small and affordable hotel in San Diego California”
Reviews.Author: Elenario
Reviews.Content: In Sept. 09' my sister and I spent 5days at the Hotel Occidental in San Diego. It was a great experience. Staff was friendly and competent and helpful. Room was spare but attractive, comfortable and clean. If one is in reasonably good shape, hotel is within walking distance of the Gas Lamp District and Balboa Park. A tasty complimentary breakfast is served daily. We appreciated the small size of this hotel as well as it's convenient location. Our 2nd. floor room faced Elm St. and was noisy some nights. Overall, a great find, thanks to TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “so grim.”
Reviews.Author: pinkroo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at places like this before, and thought they were fine--this one is just a little too cheerless for me. The tiny cubicle of a room, the airplane flight path directly overhead, the street noise and light that the miniblind just could not deal with, the lack of anywhere to eat right around the hotel, no bathtubs (showers only)--I just couldn't do it. I had reserved 7 nights there, left after one. The staff, esp. Ecaterina on the swing shift, were very pleasant and helpful, and if you are totally prepared and aware of what you're getting, it would be fine. I realized for me, it was not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Homey and down to earth experience”
Reviews.Author: TheGmanTijuana
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for easy access to downtown nightlife. The rooms are clean and quiet with a few small amenities that make it a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Occidental is my kind of hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BelgianTeacher
Reviews.Content: Well, my sister needed to go to San Diego for her job and I tagged along for fun. Being a thorough kind of person I researched all possible hotels beforehand on the internet, and I picked this one. And I wasn't wrong! It's in a very good location, close to downtown and even better: close to Balboa Park. The hotel is relaxed and the staff very, very friendly and helpful. Being European we thought the breakfast was a bit too sweet (pastries), but there was bread to be toasted, cream cheese and fruit in this complimentary breakfast too, and we bought a loaf of darker bread, tomatoes and hard cheese ourselves which we took to breakfast without a problem. So breakfast became a lot of fun. The selection of tea was nice as well. The breakfast room is a bit small, but you can take breakfast to your room if you want. The free bikes were wonderful. We ride bikes in our country (Belgium) all the time, so it was great to try it in San Diego. The slopes are a bit steeper, though! My sister took her laptop to work on her presentation and she could use the free internet connection. We loved having a kitchenette in the room, so we could use the microwave to prepare some food and the crockery and cutlery provided to eat it. The small fridge was great to put in the food and drink we bought. The showers were across the hallway and always spotlessly clean (and available; we never had to wait one minute). We could do the laundry at the hotel too, which was lovely because you don't have to walk the streets with your dirty clothes in tow! And then there were complimentary apples and newspapers at the reception desk; what more could you want? And now for a comparison: colleagues of my sister were staying at one of the very expensive hotels close to the convention center (I've forgotten the name, but it had two tower blocks). They had a swimming pool, yes, but if they wanted to rent a bike they had to pay something like 10 dollars an hour or 30 dollars a day. Breakfast was not even included in the high price and after having delivered 1 (one!) message the reception desk complained this should not be a regular occurence! We were so pleased that we had chosen this hotel when we heard my sister's colleagues describe their hotel! I've never written a review for a hotel before, although I've travelled a lot all over the world, but I really, really liked this charming and not-too-expensive hotel in the wonderful city of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: astrosrgr8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! I was by myself and wanted an affordable safe place to stay in a good location and this was definitely it. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet stayed open late and the free bikes were a tremendous plus. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “'Fantastic'”
Reviews.Author: Sojournmaster
Reviews.Content: ...with a risk of making this hotel even more popular, on balance, taking into account location, value, experience, comfort, cleanliness,friendliness of staff, this hotel score high in all and overall i felt a good choice. Good location near park and downtown. I have stayed at many hotels and this one is a real treasure for the price conscious. I plan to stay again when next in san Diego. Thanks, Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff, but Hotel itself Not So”
Reviews.Author: latinles1
Reviews.Content: I came for a wedding in San Diego and at the bride's behest was told to stay at this hotel due to the "rehearsal" dinner being held at this hotel. And I must say the staff was courteous and helpful. I wished they worked at a better venue. For one thing the hotel is located in a rather rundown area. The place itself had no ATM. Was told there was one at the corner liquor store, which made feel unsafe to say the least. And eventhough you couldnt get into this hotel without a room card they had this rule that you couldnt have guests after 10 PM. The cable channel selection was the barest I'ever seen in any hotel. I've gone to smaller hotels that had better. They had videos yes, but not that many. The "kitchenette" sink doubled as the bathroom sink, which to me, is a little gross - there was no sink in the bathroom. Then the A/C kicked in. The rooms do not have individual A/C control - it's centrally controlled for all rooms at the front desk. My mom got sick because the whole time we stayed there the A/C was running constantly and we had to call the front desk to turn it off. In the morning, they turned it on again and it ran constantly, and i had to call the desk at 7 am again to turn it off, because there weren't enough blankets on the bed to keep us warm. The continental breakfast was typically mediocre. Their pastries were stale. This is a hostel, not a "European style boutique hotel." Furnishings were the absolute cheapest - the least they could have done was to go with colorful, cheap IKEA furnishings to make it look more bright and cheerful like some European hostels do. IKEA mattresses certainly would have been a higher quality. Many kids rooms have better furnishings than this. The actual reception held by this hotel was also mediocre, but i was told it was a good price...Im sure considering the amount of money this hotel got from all the guests that stayed there...I started noticing hotels nearby. There was a Holiday Inn and a Motel Six that offered better value. BTW even at the cheapest hotels I got a receipt showing my charges. Like I said the only reason I got this hotel was due to the wedding bride's insistence. Next time im in Dego im going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely time!”
Reviews.Author: BristolLizzylou
Reviews.Content: I don't whether it was the loveliness of this city or a reflection of the fantastic time we had here but we found this hotel to be perfect. It was spotlessly clean, the staff couldn't have been more helpful and the breakfast was perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Single Traveller”
Reviews.Author: madsab
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night before moving to the Marriot Marina to meet up with coworkers for our convention. As a single traveler, ... my room fit the bill with twin bed, private bathroom, and kitchenette. Didn't need that much space since I was exploring most of the day. They had complimentary bottled water, popcorn, coffee, and kleenex, plus plenty of DVDs to borrow and play on the DVD/TV. I arrived early and they offered to store my luggage till check in at 2pm, and gave me map/instructions to visit Little Italy (~15 mins walk). On Saturday, Little Italy has a 'mercato' from 9:30-1:30, which had lots of fresh food and stuff to buy. Yogourtland was a great make your own dessert place, that only cost $0.30/oz. Balboa park was technically only 2 blocks away and about 15 mins walk to the official entrance and museums. Park had a nice variety of sights, but you should get there early, else most museums close by 4:30pm. If you're going to a convention, you can sometimes get 50% off exhibits, like the DaVinci exhibit. Was also able to borrow a cruiser bike, lock and helmet to bike down to the Marina boardwalk next morning. It took about 1.5 hour to travel down thru the Marina, seaport village, marriot hotel and return back via downtown/gaslamp district. Breakfast was a great selection of cereal, pastries, toast, bagel/creamcheese, coffee, juices and bananas. This was comparable to the $15 continental buffet I had at the Marriot. Also, it was pretty quiet, compared to the Marriot Hotel (which was opposite the Trolley line, where you could hear the warning bells every 15 mins until midnight). Overall a great experience and would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: MrStraightTalker
Reviews.Content: I am recently back from a month of solo-travelling in California. As I was using public transport, location was an essential factor when choosing accommodation. Hotel Occidental is just a few minutes walk from the local Greyhound bus station. I rarely needed to use public transport during my stay as most attractions are within walking distance. However, the blue line Metro takes you to Old Town, where you can catch the bus to Mission beach. I was made to feel very welcome at Hotel Occidental. The checking in process includes a general talk about the local area, which later saves time trying to find things out. Breakfast provides a range of things to eat, including fruit, which is not always the case at every hotel. The on site laundry is a useful facility for guests, as well as the free WiFi access. Rooms and shared toilet/bathroom facilities are kept very clean. Overall, Hotel Occidental represents excellent value and is particularly ideal for those people working on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “More of a hostel than a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dulcinea10
Reviews.Content: Not sure where the really good reviews of this hotel are coming from. (Perhaps the hotel management that monitors this website and advertises the overall Tripadvisor rating on theirs?) It is quite economical for a downtown hotel, and the staff is very friendly. The flower arrangements are great. And that's the sum total of the really positive stuff I can write. We reserved a double room with en suite bathroom. The room was set up really oddly - the bed was sort of stuck in the middle of the room, with the head of the bed hitting open air, so our pillows kept falling off. The bed itself was REALLY SQUEAKY, to the point that my husband, who can generally sleep anywhere, was kept awake by it. The "kitchenette" sink doubled as the bathroom sink, which to me, is a little gross - there was no sink in the bathroom. The "kitchenette" was a microwave and refrigerator with a few cabinets with dishes. We stayed in this room for one night before complaining to the management about the bed. The day manager (Rose) was really cool, acknowledging that the rooms with the double beds ALL have the problem of the squeaky mattress,and that they are not currently replacing them due to economic considerations, but hope to do so soon. She upgraded us to a Queen room, which was decidedly less squeaky and set up more nicely. Then the A/C kicked in. The rooms do not have individual A/C control - it's centrally controlled for all rooms at the front desk. When we went to bed, the A/C was running constantly and we had to call the front desk to turn it off. In the morning, they turned it on again and it ran constantly, and i had to call the desk at 7 am again to turn it off, because there weren't enough blankets on the bed to keep us warm. The continental breakfast was typically mediocre. Their pastries tended to be kinda stale. This is a hostel, not a "European style boutique hotel." Furnishings were the absolute cheapest - the least they could have done was to go with colorful, cheap IKEA furnishings to make it look more bright and cheerful like some European hostels do. IKEA mattresses certainly would have been a higher quality. All in all, a "meh" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, neat and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Allele
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, and I'm glad I stayed here for at least part of my trip to Comic Con. The staff are friendly and helpful, and although it's a bit noisy because of the airport I slept fine (and I'm a VERY light sleeper.) Parking was 10 dollars a night, and that was worth it considering how hard it is to find parking in San Diego. It's different, having the showers located outside the room but I never once had to wait to use it. Free breakfast until 11- which was great- and free wifi! Definitely better than overypaying at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very clean, lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: Boo1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a month in a single room not ensuite. The loo and shower were just opposite the room and not once during my stay did I have to wait to use either. The hotel is spotlessly clean throughout. My room was on the small side but had everything I required during my stay. The beds are on the hard side, but I didn't find it uncomfortable. The staff are all fantastic, really friendly, helpful and opened up breakfast (yummy!) early for me as I had to leave early most mornings. Free bikes are great. The hotel is well placed for Balboa park and the zoo, as well as exploring downtown San Diego. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hospitality, Great staff, Clean, Affordale, Good breakfast, near everything”
Reviews.Author: nifny
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for its good reviews and comments. And also because I did not want to stay at a huge hotel in downtown San Diego. However, the Hotel Occidental is only a 15 to 20 minute walk to most of the restaurants in downtown San Diego, Convention Center, Balboa Park, and shopping. Public transportation (bus) just across the street from the hotel. I walked everyday to the downtown San Diego area and back to the hotel with no problems. I also used their trolleys and buses during the day to go sightseeing by myself. I stay at the Occidental for a week. My room with a half bath was very clean and comfortable. I used their hallway showers which are kept very clean. Their hallway bathroom (toilets) are kept very clean as well. They also have a full bathroom for handicap or for people with disabilities. The Hotel Occidental is kept very clean (immaculate). The owner's representative Lisa Mendoza and her staff make sure that everyone who walks through the doors of the Hotel Occidental are welcome and kept comfortable while staying there. By the way their complementary breakfast (is not just a cup of coffee with bread) is more than what I expected (" is good"). "Oh and let me not forget to mention "the price". The price is really affordable compare to the other hotels in and around the downtown and other areas of San Diego. Lisa Mendoza Owner's representative, front desk people, Rose, Tomas, etc, and the staff in the housekeeping department thank you for your kindness and for making me feel comfortable during my stay. By the way if my son came come home during the Christmas Holidays I will most likely be back with my daughter and maybe a couple of friends and will be calling the Hotel Occidental.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: FizzScotland
Reviews.Content: GOOD POINTS : Friendly, helpful staff. Hotel very centrally located to lots of attractions, one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. Lovely complimentary breakfast and easy to use complimentary safe in room and free internet. Good value for money. BAD POINTS: One of the noisiest, squeakies beds I have ever slept in :-( reported to staff but no action taken to rectify. On flight path to San Diego airport so very noisy with window open. Supposed to have air conditioning? what airconditioning!!!!!!! was it the fan on the ceiling? Standard Room VERY small (felt quite claustrophobic) In summary: Very basic but spotlessly clean hotel. It's just a shame the room was soooooooooo small and the bed was soooooooooo noisy it was embarrassing!!! A matter that could easily have been rectified. Maids were very good providing clean towels and tidying room every day and communual WC/showers were always spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: goonergal69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and was very satisfied. While the rooms are basic and cozy, they are clean and have amenities like a dvd player, fridge, microwave, and free wifi. What made the stay memorable was the accommodating and friendly staff. Since I was here for the marathon, they left a goody bag with bottled water, candy, and energy chews in my room and started serving breakfast at 4:30AM on race day, which were much appreciated. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from downtown and a 5 minute walk to Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “A good-value, friendly down-to-earth place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SFGDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: There are many reviews of this hotel available and most are very good. I stayed here in May 2009 for a conference and found it met my needs very well. It is clean, comfortable and well-maintained. The shared wash-room and shower areas and very well kept and modern. The rooms, while small by American hotel standards, are certainly of an adequate size and the continental style breakfast consists of fruit, bread, bagels, b'fast cereal, tea & coffee. It is obvious from the hotel's own website that this is not high-end luxury but a comfortable 'guest-house' style of accomodation. The rooms are wired for internet and there is no charge. The hotel is almost directly under the approach path of planes for the airport as is Balboa park and much of this part of the city. The planes are however not a problem in my opinion. I was on the second floor and found the sound-proofing/double-glazing meant that there was no disturbance at all. This hotel is about 15mins walk from the central business district & 25 from the conference centre. If walking use the western side (right-hand sied on the way in) of 4th Ave as the junctions are easier to negotiate. Taxis are not expensive and you can get to the airport for $10-12.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, excellent staff, old but clean hotel and very comfortable - yummy breakfast pastries!”
Reviews.Author: dnatin
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded (i think), but the our room is old style but beautifully restored to like new. It is basic but spacious, the most spacious so far. Unlike every other hotel i have stayed in my two month trip on both USA coasts breakfast is served until 11am (most were 9.30) and was fantastic for a continental breakfast. The laundromat has four washing machines and four dryers so you can wash at any time up until 9pm for 1.25USD per load. Most only had 1 machine and dryer. Our room is huge and fully self contained with a real fridge, stove etc The complimentary bikes are popular, i saw 10 this morning and now there are 2 left! Thanks to others that previously reviewed this hotel, the staff and amenities are second to none for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Euro Style hotel”
Reviews.Author: chimbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a full en-suite room. The Occidental is located around 15/20 mins from Downtown, which meant you can walk to the Gaslamp area, and catch a taxi back for less than $10. There are also regular buses outside up to the Hillcrest district and downtown. The room was spotless, almost sterile !! The bathroom and room I guess are functional, but really do the job. There very quiet, even with the regular low flying planes overhead. The staff are very helpful, printing off bus routes, info etc. The breakfast is in an ajoining building, with bagels and a toaster a welcome respite from muffins and pastries seen elsewhere. With a price of $109 this was a bargin, with street parking nearby - you do have to drive around to find a space, but the area is good, so no issues with saftey for the car.

Reviews.Title: “Really a gem!, everything I wanted!”
Reviews.Author: camkego
Reviews.Content: My name is Cameron Elliott, and I stayed at the Occidental 4/20/09-4/22/09. This was my first stay there. Before I picked the Occidental, I researched sites at tripadvisor.com. Initially, I was suspicious of all the positive feedback on Tripadvisor, and I had to wonder if the owners were posting their own positive ratings for the hotel. But I have to say, I was very pleasantly suprised when I arrived at the Occidental, everything is well kept and super clean. the breakfast is good, and open 7-11am! (Many places will have breakfast for a couple of hours, making it less useful) I was also pleased to find out about free internet, telephone calls, and in-room safe. These are often extra costs at other places, and nice to see included. But probably one of the nicest things about the Occidental was Lisa, she was so helpful in helping me locate whatever I needed nearby, and planning a day trip to Mexico. Its pretty clear she is one of the main reasons the Occidental is such a great value and comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: darkness1
Reviews.Content: Exceeded expectations. Ok, this hotel is not by any means a hostel. Yes, the bathrooms are outside of the rooms, but they are private and immaculately clean. This is typical European style, and save considerable costs for the hotel that translates to cheaper rooms. The hotel is in the city, but a little outside of downtown, but the area is not a war zone or anything. It is also very close to the interstate, making it a 15 minute max drive to pacific and mission beach. the entire place is extremely clean, and comfortable; the rooms are small yet include a sink, microwave, small counter space, midsize fridge and cubby-like shelf space. Sound can be an issue I guess, but you are staying in a city, and close to an airport. The patio, smoking area is very cute. They have coin-washers and always have fruit in the lobby. Breakfast was good, although not hot food. Staff was very attentive, cleaning staff was very thorough. Here's a breakdown: Price: Excellent for what you get. get over the disconnected bathrooms, you're not going to run into anyone in the hallway, they are well maintained, and you can lock the door. There are also enough of them where there is typically no waiting for one. Free wireless, free beach cruiser rental. Rooms: Bright, simple, very clean. ample space to stay the night, if you're spending any more time in the room in San Diego there's something wrong with you. Go to the beach for god sakes. Kitchenette in the room with sink, microwave, small fridge, dishware and towels. Cubby like shelves and hanging space. A decent desk with reading light close to phone. Free wireless, also a cat5 port in the phone. Food: Pretty good included breakfast. Pastries every morning, bagels with cream cheese butter or jam. Hot coffee or hot water. 4 choices of cold cereal, assorted oatmeal. OJ and apple juice. Bananas, apples. Instant coffee and tea, 2 bottles of water and a microwave popcorn in the room. Vending also available. Apples in the lobby. Staff: Cleaning staff were really nice, very thorough. Never had issues with the room, or the bathrooms, i think they cleaned the bathrooms a couple times a day. Front desk person was 24/7 and always helpful and sweet. Rose was very cool. Location: not super, but not a war zone, was upper area near Balboa park, quick access to the highway (15 minutes tot he beach!!) Cons: parking is difficult to find. They have a couple of spaces but its $10 a day. Street parking is metered 8am to 6pm, there was a garage available but i didn't use it. I spent the days at the beach so it wasn't so much of an issue, and parking enforcement seemed to be lacking in the area. It would be nice if the room had a thermostat, but you can deal with it, I dunno what temp it was but it was even and tolerable. If I can't stay on the beach, this will be my new usual spot. Had a great feel, and was very fun to stay at! Thanks guys! Dave

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for travelers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveloften
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights while attending a conference at the convention center. It is a 1.3 mile/30 minute walk to the convention center (about 4 blocks of this is up/down hill). This hotel was perfect for my budget. I had a twin room with shared bath. The shared toilet and shower were clean, and I never had to wait to use them. Clean towels were provided daily. The front desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was clean - yes, it is small, but my twin room was perfect for one person. I had a table and chair to do some work. The sink, mirror, refridgerator, microwave area was very nice to have in the room. The breakfast room is small, but adequate, and juice, coffee, cereal, fruit, pastries, and bagels were available. There is a Mexican take-out restaurant one block from the hotel. In the Gaslamp district between the hotel and convention center (along 4th and 5th Avenues), you will find plenty of restaurants and the Horton shopping plaza. There were homeless people sitting/sleeping on the sidewalks along 4th Ave., but they were not aggressive or threatening.

Reviews.Title: “Bicycle to Balboa Park from the delightful Hotel Occidental!”
Reviews.Author: WwonU
Reviews.Content: Close to Balboa Park the Hotel Occidental is a bright, quiet, sparkling clean and very pleasant place to stay where the friendly staff are helpful day and night. Internet and DVDs are included. The breakfast room is great for indoor or outdoor morning coffee with croissants and/or a variety of offerings. Every day for four days I enjoyed bicycling on an Occidental silver blue or royal blue bicycle to the Old Globe Theatre, galleries and museums nearby (at Balboa Park as mentioned). This is my second stay at the Occidental as I find it a comfortable, safe and elegant place with easy access to town, the park etc. by bicycle included with the room (booking for the time or day as needed). I highly recommend this delightful, gracious hotel to friends and travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place - Includes a lot and is more than affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Casey50
Reviews.Content: I worked with Lisa who runs the Occidental and it was an excellent experience. I had a group of 20 students staying there during Spring Break. It was the University of North Texas Lacrosse team on a trip to play games against California Schools, and Lisa were very accomodating. The hotel was perfect for my group, had free wi-fi, free breakfast (important to athletes), nice clean rooms and public areas, and is in a good location close to the city. Will definitely be using again next year

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. You won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: jeremyw90
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in December. I was considering moving to San Diego and needed an affordable place to stay for an extended period. Room was very clean, modern, and cozy. Free wifi, breakfast. The staff was AMAZINGLY kind to me. They gave me a discount on my rate as well! I looked at some other extended stay hotels in downtown San Diego....WOW, total nightmares! One had roaches all over the room, nasty stains on carpet, and weird bum types wandering the halls. The hotel occidental has none of that. Clean, affordable, and "normal" type guests.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine if you don't want luxurious”
Reviews.Author: N&YinNJ
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive place to stay for a few days whilst in San Diego on a conference and I planned to spend most of my time in Balboa Park, Old Town and Gastown. Hotel Occidental was quite perfect for my needs - within walking distance to Balboa, close to the tram lines and comes with breakfast. The rooms are small (I opted for the shared bath) - but they are clean, and come with a sink, microwave, table, etc. If you need anything other than instant coffee, be sure to bring your Melitta drip cup... The original room I was assigned to faced the street - and I requested an inside room, which was very quiet. Although the hotel was booked, there was very little noise, and the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's true: This is wondeful”
Reviews.Author: travelerfrom1970
Reviews.Content: Everything I've read about this hotel is spot on. It's impeccably clean, the staff is incredibly warm, it's excellent value for money, it's safe and homey, etc., etc. I stayed for 6 nights while attending a conference in the city. The Occidental is close to downtown, but it was several blocks, still, from my conference hotel. That wasn't a problem because each day I was able to checkout (for free) one of their lovely bikes to get around town on. I had a twin size bed, and, yes, the rooms are small. And, the walls are thin. (That was only a problem on one night. I called the clerk, and he took care of the situation right away.) The rooms are very cozy. And, you have a kitchennette. They have free DVDS to check out (again, for free). -- And, so, I think the rooms were just the right size. My bathroom and shower rooms were right across the hall from me, and I almost never had to wait for them. AND, they were incredibly clean. The lobby is impeccably furnished. There are several nice touches. The continental breakfast is great. The staff is WONDERFUL and made my trip so special. And, the value is excellent!!! San Diego is an expensive city. The rate I had at the Occidental was very, very reasonable. I was sad to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: kris47
Reviews.Content: this hotel was an awesome find since i wanted to be near downtown and gaslamp but didnt want to pay $200-300 for the other hotels or stay at a motel 6. the lobby attendant was really nice and helpful. i tried not to having any expectations about the the room but i was still surprised to walk in and find it so small. being 6'3" i felt a little claustrophobic and i felt like i had to be overly cautious not to bang my head/elbows/knees on anything. however it was somewhat inviting and very clean and neat. the bed was a full so my feet hung off and it was a little cramped for me and my girlfriend. it was also a bit stiff and made plastic crunching sounds everytime we moved. needless to say neither of us slept very well that night, although the pillows were cushy. the out of room shower and bathroom were very clean but again i felt really cramped in the shower and getting to the bathroom across the hall in the middle of the night was somewhat embarassing. the hotel is within walking distance of downtown, seaport village, and balboa park, or if you opt for a cab ride to these places its less than $5. the hotel does offer free bike rentals which is really cool. we checked out on a sunday around 10am and wanted to rent the bikes but since checkout was at 11am we would have had to have them back by that time. the guy at the front desk said he would have let us take some but since the hotel was fully booked he couldnt. he was very nice about it but it was disappointing. overall hotel occidental is a great value and worth staying at if you are by yourself and dont plan on actually being in the hotel for long. id stay there again but i wouldnt want to share a room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: The place isn't fancy, but it's very comfortable and the staff is fantastic. We had a big room with a refrigerator and microwave. It's very basic, white walls and plain gray carpet, but it was extremely clean and full of little extras that made it very comfortable. The bathroom setup is a little unusual, the actual bathroom only has a shower and toilet, but there's a small kitchen counter area out in the room with a sink. Some people might not like this, but we thought the convenience of having counter and cabinet space with a kitchen-style sink more than made up for it. Our kitchen area had no stove, but did have cupboards with plates and silverware. The whole staff was polite and extremely helpful. The whole place has free wireless high-speed Internet and the continental breakfast was very good. The hotel also has lots of very pleasant common areas. The front porch is every bit as pleasant as it looks in the photos on their Web site, it's a great place to sit and have a cocktail. There's also a small outdoor dining area that's nice. The location is good, close to the park. It's not all that close to a lot of the tourist attractions, but we didn't mind, it was a pleasant area. Overall, it was a tremendous value and a great place. One tiny gripe: There was some sort of plastic cover on the mattress under the sheets that made loud crinkling noises. Not a big deal, but sort of irritating, something they might want to look into changing.

Reviews.Title: “Good value simple hotel in a brilliant location with fantastic bikes!”
Reviews.Author: HI3
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides basic, but clean, modern and simple accommodation in a great location, a short bike ride or a medium walk from everything San Diego has to offer. The check-in staff were polite and friendly, helping us plan out what to do and where to go. Our room was small, but immaculately clean. It had an ensuite toilet, plus a small kitchen area with microwave and fridge and was right next door to a shower room that we never had to queue for (there seemed to be one shower room for every two or three rooms). The other facilities were great, a large and very cheap laundry, a good continental breakfast that you could eat outdoors on the terrace and free bike hire - fantastic "beach cruisers" (once you'd got to grips with having to reverse peddle to brake!). I'd definitely recommend this place for all but those looking for top luxury. ***Further tip: Borrow a bike and take it down to the seaport area and take a ferry to Coronado Island and bike around it. Great fun, even for novice cyclists.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: AugerMa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Occidental Hotel for 4 nights in the beggining of August with my 7 year-old son. This hotel was just perfect for us. We walked to Balboa Park and downtown. The rooms are small, it's true, but we don't mind. It's new (IKEA designed), nice, comfortable and perfectly clean. We had a room with a toilet, a refrigerator and a microwave. It was usefull. The shower, just beside our room, was also perfectly clean. Breakfast is included and it's good : croissants and viennoiseries, bagels, cereals, fruits, real orange juice, coffee, etc. The persons at the front desk are really nice and gave us all the information we needed about the places we wanted to visit. The laundry room is also very convenient. It's my favorite hotel in California! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: OKBarb
Reviews.Content: On arriving in San Diego, I stopped by the Tourist Information Center, the lady had just taken a tour of the hotel a couple a week before. Even though I had never stayed in a European style hotel, she was so excited about it that I decided to at least check it out. I just fell in love with it when I came in the door. It is newly renovated, just pristine. Fresh fruit, flowers, and the friendliest staff greet you. I checked out the room and found it to be spotless, comfortable with refrigerator and micowave. The shower was close by and also spotless. The rates were far below anything I expected, so I decided to stay a week. I never drove my car that week, as I was 3 blocks from Balboa Park, a few blocks from downtown, and close to the air port and waterfront. The best part was meeting people from different countries while having the best continental breakfast. I am back home after a 35 day journey, and as I look back on my trip, this was by far, the most wonderful place I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lylac27
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service and clean rooms. Rooms are small and simple but the location and value is GREAT!! We walked and biked to Balboa Park, Seaport Village, Harbor Island, and the Gaslamp District. Will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jessotr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for over a week and had a good experience. On the first day we were allowed early check-in, and the staff was beyond accomodating. Lisa at the front desk helped up with everything from directions to helping me with my luggage upstairs. The room was clean and the fridge & microwave are nice especially if you are on a budget. They have a small, gated parking area, but only so many spots and it's $10/day, but worth it if you want to keep your car off the street. You can walk about 10-15 minutes to the Gaslamp District where there are tons of bars and restaurants. The only problem I can see is if you are an exceptionally tall or large person, you may take issue with the smaller beds and rooms. Try for the really nice Queen room if you are tall. For the money, you really can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “great value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: elts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Occidental for one night at both the beginning and the end of our trip to California in November. On both occasions, the staff were extremely helpful (I still haven't thought of a name for the Giraffe!!), the rooms were very clean, the accomodation suited our needs (a bed for the night). Next time I'll book a room with a bath; while I'm used to sharing a shower etc (I'm in the RAF) my wife isn't, and wasn't overly keen. The hotel is really handy for the Zoo and surrounding attractions, its a nice 20 minute stroll (mind out for locals scrounging for change though). Overall I'd happily stay here agian, although for longer trips i'd maybe choose somewhere a bit more central.

Reviews.Title: “Very different”
Reviews.Author: MysNobody
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Hotel Occidental are very different. They are much more in the style of a dorm room than an actual U.S. hotel room. Positives: The hotel is very quiet. The hotel staff are very nice and try to be helpful. The room seem to be very clean. The cost is extremely reasonable and includes free wireless internet access and breakfast. Cons: There were a few negatives however. First the hotel does not have enough parking for all its guests and it is provided on a "first come, first serve" basis. All other guests park on the street which is free in the evenings until 8 am in the morning (after which it is metered). Second, there is no elevator. When I was staying there I had two heavy suitcases full of documents and I was on the 2nd floor. The hotel staff on duty was very helpful and carried the heavier bag but it was a rather exhausting experience. Third and fourth negatives were also listed as positives and deals with the accessiblity of the internet and the breakfast. I had chosen this hotel because of the free wireless internet. Unfortunately, the password I was provided did not work on my computer. Though the hotel staff attempted to assist me, they were unable to help me access the internet (which was very frustrating as it was a business trip). With regard to the breakfast, what was offered seemed extremely sweet (muffins, danishes, sugar-y cereals, etc.). Also, the breakfast dining area was very small and dirty by the time I got there (which is only about 15-30 minutes after 7.)

Reviews.Title: “Really not as expected!”
Reviews.Author: Straight5
Reviews.Content: I was expecting too much from this hotel given the reviews but let's face it, the hotel is really not that great. In particular, do not expect great and confortable rooms, they are very very small. Just expect small and clean hotel and you may be fine with it. To be honest, I did'nt like it. The lady at the desk was very nice, in contrast to the guy who was kind of 'cold'...

Reviews.Title: “Bargain at twice the price”
Reviews.Author: eamonn708
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Hotel Occidental and felt compelled to write this review. Check-in was completed within 2 minutes and helpful information was given about the city. It is in an excellent location just a 10 minute walk from the centre of downtown and right next to Balboa Park. The room size was adequate and included a small kitchen counter with sink, microwave, cutlery, plates etc. There was TV with 30 local cable channels and a dvd function. The welcome pack in the room contained books and information as well as tea/coffee/bottled water. The rooms are air-conditioned and this was most welcome in the very hot weather of San Diego. Everyone in the hotel was pleasant and offered a smile everytime. Breakfast was good, nothing much but again adequate, cereal and pastries and the like. Breakfast was available from 7am to 11pm. It was a pleasure to stay here and a bargain, will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Liars, Noisey, Unsympathetic”
Reviews.Author: ttttttttttttttttttt
Reviews.Content: I asked the agent directly whether you could hear planes flying overhead. She said no. I explained that it was very important to me that the room be quiet. She was not honest with me. My friend and I were woken up at 6:30am by airplanes the next morning. When I approached her in the morning, she said that she meant that there were no planes at night, but that they start flying over at 6:30am. I didn't realize that most of their customers wake up before 6:30am. Last I checked, most people sleep in a little later when on vacation! On top of it all, the manager was unsympathetic and made excuses about having to cover costs and so would only partially reduce the cost of my room. They're ammateurs at this hotel. Who lies to customers and then refuses to reimburse the fee?????

Reviews.Title: “Small, Noisy, Yet Convenient”
Reviews.Author: morgie55
Reviews.Content: There were no mix-ups with my reservation and checking in was fast. Friendly, helpful staff and lots of green apples at the front door. Yes, I also had the dreaded room 109. It's a small twin bed, not so hard. The window faces the patio area which unfortunately is a smoking area. So if your window is open you get the smoke drifing in as well as loud conversation. There should be a curfew or cut-off time for the patio where it is closed after midnight. I understand people's "clocks" are different with various time zones but give a guy a break! The jets do fly close, but it's really no big deal. Big fan, cable TV was adequate. The showers in the hallway were clean but being used at times inconvenient. The bathroom area has high ceiling and a loud echo. Don't slam the toilet lid down unless you want jarred eardrums! Good location, near Balboa Park, the Zoo and a short walk to the trolley to get to the convention center. I got what I got for the cheap price. I may fork over a bit more money for the convenience of a personal shower, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: northstartravels
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel for the right traveler, but could be a problem for a some. The positives are price, clean and comfortable rooms, price, attractive if simple lobby and public spaces, price, and friendly staff. I stayed at the hotel with my daughter. The rooms can be small, but I booked the largest room with a private bath and it was fairly spacious. Think IKEA furnishings-- attractive, efficient and budget Euro-style. The hotel was clean and the staff were great. Wifi access is free and easy; the typical cereal and pastries with juices and coffee-tea breakfast was free; and there was a bowl of free fruit...they apologized for charging $10 for off-street parking, which would have been twice the price at most hotels. We paid about $125/night for the most expensive accommodations. In short, great value! The drawbacks. Obviously, don't stay here if you want pampering and luxurious surroundings. The less obvious concern is location. It was fine for us, but it is not in the most luxurious part of town. There is a bar and liquor store around the corner, and it was "borderline" in terms of feel (not unsafe seeming, but not real attractive or lively). The location is very convenient for on/off of the highway, a long walk from downtown and a shorter walk to Balboa Park, but there are no restaurants or retail in the immediate area. It reminds me of the Mosser Hotel in San Francisco, but in a less desirable location. A great stay for the budget minded traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value!”
Reviews.Author: alegnaleigh
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here! We were a little skeptical at first because of the shared bathrooms, but this hotel was immaculate, beautiful and we had a wonderful stay. Everything looked brand new. We had some trouble at check-in with a lost reservation, but they made up for it and we were happy. The hotel is in walking distance of the gaslamp district and Balboa park. we even walked down to the seaport village with no trouble. The first night we had a room with a half bath, and there was a shower right across the hall. The second night we were in a larger room with a full bath. Both rooms had nice little kitchenettes. There is a free breakfast that is very good. The front desk is very good about helping out with directions. Oh, best of all is the price! Well under $100/ night.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Value”
Reviews.Author: stryx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the the Hotel Occ. for a week in June while attending a convention. I was pleased with the experience and would stay there again. I arrived at the hotel after a $10 cab ride from the airport. Check in went smoothly. My room was a shared bath w/ twin bed. The room itself was clean and tastefully appointed. It had a desk w/ lamp, bed, TV w/ cable, open shelved "closet" w/ safe, and a full kitchenette with cabinet, sink, microwave, and fridge. There was one window that opened on to the air shaft. The doors on all of the rooms are metal fire doors. While this leads to a comforting sense of security, the sound can be a little annoying when they are being opened and closed in the morning. The hotel provides a decent breakfast. There is an ATM on site and laundry machines are available. The entire hotel is non-smoking, though there are places available outside. Parking is quite limited. I'd guess that they couldn't park more than 10 cars on-site, but there is on-street parking available and there are surface lots nearby. I was attending a conference at the convention center (as were at least half a dozen other guests). It's about a 20-30 minute walk there, or about a $12 cab ride, or the bus runs right past the hotel. I didn't visit Balboa Park, but I'd believe other commenters that it is within walking distance. Even though I stayed in the cheapest room the Hotel Occidental had, I was quite pleased. The hotel seemed clean, friendly, and safe. It's in a strategic location and the price was perfect for my needs. The fact that they provide free 54Mbps wireless was a beautiful gift.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: patchworkearth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The staff is unbelievably friendly!!! Seriously, the manager, Lisa, is the most helpful person ever. We were pleased with all of the staff. The housekeeping staff was superb. They were really great...even washed our dishes! Our room was really small, but we had a toilet right in our room and also a kitchenette. The shared showers were no big deal at all...they were always super clean and it was a cozy little room with plenty of room in the shower. My only complaint is the bed. I swear it was the squeakiest bed in the entire universe! And I am really not a picky person. Other than that, the hotel was really quiet. The breakfast was included in the price and was EXCELLENT. They had fresh muffins, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, bottled water, coffee, juice, milk. There is a courtyard/garden area that is very pretty. There is also a laundry room. One of the employees overheard me talking about needing a dryer sheet, and he went into the housekeeping room and gave me some! How nice. This is also the same guy that flagged down a taxi in the middle of traffic and helped me with my heavy suitcase all from the kindness of his heart. The location is good too, although not in the best part of town. But the security was impeccable. It is in walking distance of Balboa Park (the zoo), the trolley station, downtown, and Little Italy. STAY HERE. You won't be disappointed. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great budget stay”
Reviews.Author: KVMechelen
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are visiting San Diego and don't want to spend at least $150 a day. Location is close to Balboa Park and not too far from Downtown either. The shared bathrooms and showers are very clean. The (free) breakfast is simple but very well done. Service is A+.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent inexpensive hotel with free bicycles”
Reviews.Author: Occasional_traveler1
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience when staying at the Hotel Occidental for seven days in May 2007. Clean (but small) room with a comfortable regular bed, a fold-out bed, a television, a fan and a kitchenette with a microwave oven, sink and refrigerator. I paid $69.00 per night for the room (excluding taxes). My room had free coffee, bottled water and unpopped popcorn. The room had no toilet, shower or closet. My room had no clock when I arrived. The desk staff provided a clock-radio when I requested a clock. The hotel looks like it was recently renovated. There were no cracks in walls or ceilings, the paint job was good, etc. There were no signs of insect or rodent infestations. There were three shared bathrooms in the hall on the floor on which I stayed. Two of the bathrooms had a toilet and a sink. One had only a toilet. All were clean. Staff immediately corrected a backed-up toilet when notified of problem. There was at least one room in the hall that contained a shower for guests' use. The bathrooms and the shower were always vacant when I needed to use them. Good maid service each day. Friendly, helpful desk staff. Good free continental breakfast from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. with plenty of cereal, bananas, apples, rolls, muffins, coffee, milk and fruit juices. An adjacent room had a microwave oven for heating oatmeal at the breakfast. The hotel's lobby had free apples and chocolates throughout the day and evening. The best feature of the hotel were four free top-of-the-line bicycles . Only one or two were in use each day. The hotel is one block away from Balboa Park, about one mile from the shoreline of San Diego Bay (great sightseeing along walking and biking trails), from the downtown central business area and from the Gaslamp Quarter, and about two miles from the San Diego convention center. It took less than 20 minutes to reach each of these by bicycle. The hotel has only a few parking spaces. However, it is near several major bus routes with frequent service. I took two city buses to reach the hotel from the airport . The trip took about 45 minutes, including waiting times. Not bad for $2.25. The hotel is beneath a flight path to the airport. However, airplane and traffic noise was only a problem in the room between 7:30 and 8:30 a.m. At all other times, the room was quiet. The hotel's neighborhood is not fancy, but is clean and good. No obvious concerns about safety in the neighborhood. I recommend the Hotel Occidental to anyone who wants a clean room near downtown San Diego for a relatively low price. I highly recommend the hotel for people like me who believe that bicycles are the best way to travel and to go sightseeing when in a city.

Reviews.Title: “The Occidental is fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: lizetteorama
Reviews.Content: The Occidental was perfect for our quick weekend trip to San Diego. The location was incredible - walking distance to Balboa Park and the zoo. They also rent bikes which we didn't learn until after....rats! We opted for the room with a small bathroom but no shower. I did not mind the community showers at all (they are private) for the incredible deal we got. Even the crappiest run-of-the-mill hotel around that neighborhood was nearly double the price. We had a small kitchenette and the fridge was very handy for storing some beers. Perfect for single or couple travelers on a budget. The rooms and beds are small but guests should be out exporing the city not wasting their precious time in the hotel watching television.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the H.O.”
Reviews.Author: medcat3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the H.O. during a conference that attracted over 40,000 (!) participants to the city of San Diego. That being said, I waited late to reserve a hotel and found that all rooms had been booked..except for Hotel Occidental. I must admit I was very very surprised about how awesome this palce was. First and foremost the hotel was spotless. This is probably the most important factor when I book a hotel. My room had a refridgerator, microwave, sink, and TV. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to the Convention Center. This is a doable walk during the day but I would not recommend it at night. The hotel is close to Balboa Park. My only complaint is the hotel's WiFi. It was very shoddy and would only work in like two or 3 minute bursts. This is a small complaint however as the convention center provided free wifi during the conference. Highly Recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Occidental”
Reviews.Author: sallycello
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, near Balboa Park and the Gaslamp Quarter. The room we had was small and very bare bones in its furnishings, with exposed pipes under the ceiling. The bathroom had no sink and no fan, and the kitchenette was right in the bedroom. The bed was comfortable, the premises clean, the continental breakfast was excellent and the staff was pleasant and helpful. Unfortunately the hotel is in the flight path of airplanes descending to land at the airport, and the resulting noise was unpleasant and disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “Occidental is the best”
Reviews.Author: LauraPatricia
Reviews.Content: If I had to design a perfect budget hotel, I couldnt come up with anything better than the Occidental. It looked promising from Trip Advisor reviews, but still my friend and I were thrilled when we saw its lovely exterior in downtown San Diego. Inside was every bit as impressive. My room was comfortable and clean, a bargain anywhere, but especially in a high price city like San Diego. It was impeccably clean and there was no problem using the shared showers which were always cleaned between guests. Best of all were the staff, led by Lisa, who were outstandingly helpful and pleasant. I've worked on a hotel reception and it can get wearying answering the same questions day after day, but Occidental staff responded with enthusiasm to every question. Very pleasant to enjoy the free breakfast in the sunny courtyard before setting off to make the most of San Diego's charms. Nice to come back at the end of a day to smiles and free dvds if you wanted a rest. I explored San Diego thoroughly but I'm tempted to go back when I know I can stay there so comfortably and problem free. And next time I'd like to ride one of the free bikes - you had to be up early!

Reviews.Title: “A San Diego Secret”
Reviews.Author: Bravo6
Reviews.Content: At first glance the white mission style building appears historic and charming, upon walking into the lobby you are greeted by a large bouquet of fresh flowers, warm modern elegently apointed furnishings, art from the Panamanian Expo from 1915 when Balboa Park opened, as well as a Customer Service Agent eager to help you in any way. All of the Customer Service Agents are also your own personal Concierge ready to help with directions, attractions, extra towels..or anything else you might need. Once checked in you will find your room clean, quite, beautifully and simply furnished along with Black and White photos and T.V. All in all the hotel has much to offer, free wi-fi, breakfast and great bikes to use around the city. With the great location, exceptional prices and beautiful styleings this hotel is a must for all San Diego visiters, students, professionals and familes alilke.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, and really friendly!”
Reviews.Author: stephsokewl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance from downtown sandiego and balboa park. Our stay was fantastic: the rooms were immaculately clean and well appointed, the hotel was quiet, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The night staff at the desk was even polite and courteous; nice to see when at most hotels you cant even find the night person. All in all, this hotel will be getting our business any time we go back to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable hotel. I like this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Netrunner
Reviews.Content: I visited San Diego for a english course at LSI. I stud at the Occidental for 4 weeks and I really enjoyed it. I had a single room with my own bathroom. In my room was a little kitchenette with a microwave, a sink, a fridge and dishes for one person. The room was small but cosy and new furnished. The bed was comfortable so I slept very well. If the window was open it was a little bit noisy, because the airport and the freeway is not far away. But it was never a problem for me. If it's a problem for you, take some earplugs. There was also a fan and a small safe in the room. The hotel is very clean and I think this is one of the most important things in a hotel. The staff is very kind. You get any information you want around the clock. For breakfast they had muffins, bons, oatmeal, cereals, coffee, tea, milk, beverages and fresh fruits. There is a soda machine and a ATM at the hotel and a park area for your car. The Occidental is very central. Here are some destinations within walking distance: The Balboa Park: 3 minutes to the park, 20 minutes to the center of the park and to the San Diego Zoo. The park is perfect for jogging. There are very nice gardens (rose garden, desert garden, japanese garden, ...) and a lot of museums. Dont miss the park! The San Diego Zoo is the best zoo I've ever seen. Little Italy: 10 minutes Nice restaurants and a trolley station Gaslamp Quarter (Downtown): 10-15 minutes Nice pubs, restaurants and great NIGHTLIFE. If you want to go shopping in Downtown take a look at the "Horton Plaza". Around the Occidental are some bus stations. The next trolley stations are in Little Italy and Downtown. I'm sure if i come back to San Diego I will stay in this nice hotel. Matthias Wilfinger (29) Germany

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, felt like home the staff was like family so helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: roxxy19
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay with the Hotel Occidental. It was my first time in San Diego and I wasn't sure of my way around. The hotel is really close to the downtown area and a huge beautiful park with all sorts of activities like the famous San Diego zoo. My room was beautiful, clean and comfortable I found the hotel to be quite charming. I'm still surprised at how beautiful this hotel is considering the rates are so reasonable I would have expect to pay a lot more. Thank you Hotel Occidental for making my trip unforgettable I can't wait for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that great”
Reviews.Author: adee7
Reviews.Content: Reminds me of a dayroom. OK for an overnight but definitely not more than that. Who wants to be running down the hallway in the middle of the night just to use the WC. Also, there's no faucet and sink to wash your hands inside the WC so beware of the door handles. If you want your own bath just spend more and you're ok. Not so quiet, you can hear the water running from the next room, door slamming, cars from the street , people talking out in the hallway, etc.... definitely not for the light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “One problem after another”
Reviews.Author: a_houston_traveler
Reviews.Content: Two gilrfriends and I thought we had booked a room with one double bed and one twin bed at the Hotel Occidental. When we arrived, the hotel did not have the promised room availalbe and thought we checked in the day prior to the reservation confirmation we had received from hotels.com. They offered us one room with a double bed and after 30-60 min finally brought us a roll away bed that barely fit in the tiny dormitory style room. They offered us another room down the hall with a twin bed to tack on to the double room, but we declined the option since we were already getting settled into the one room, and the time was nearing midnight. After a sleepless night with car alarms and other disturbances, we were unable to secure a room that met our original desired specifications for the rest of our stay. We were also unable to receive a discount as compensation for the error. After finding a young, half naked woman passed out on the floor in the hallway, we were sure it was time to move on. Hotels.com found us a clean, spacious room for the remainder of our stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware: Fraudulent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsm95tsi
Reviews.Content: Here is the story of how an experience with a hotel went from adequate to a nightmare with the hotel committing a confirmed (ask Visa) case of CREDIT CARD FRAUD. Although I stayed here in early June, my experience has just ended yesterday. I was moving from the East Coast to San Diego and I knew I needed a hotel with weekly rates to use as a home base until I found an apartment. I discovered Hotel Occidental online, being from far away I could not see any hotels before staying there and this was one of the few options that had real reviews and information beyond a name, address and phone number. Despite having shared bathrooms, this place seemed clean and safe. It was. After reading on the website that there were rates starting at $200 a week, I called the hotel. I was informed that the cheapest weekly room they had was $285. When I inquired about the $200 a week rooms I was told they were all booked. I asked the difference between the two rooms, I was told both had shared bath, kitchenette and a twin bed. I was told the $285 room was "quite a bit bigger." I was suspicious as soon as I checked into my room, I don't imagine there was any smaller room in this hotel. I could describe it, but I will let the pictures do it for me. There was no desk like described in another review. The room had no clock. No place in the room to hang wet towels. There was a counter with sink/microwave and cabinet with 1 dish, 1 plate, 1 fork, etc... The bed was more like a cot than anything. Although comfortable for my short, week long stay, it was far cheaper than almost every hotel bed I've had up to this point. All these things were minor and wouldn't give a hotel a 1 star review, Everything went smoothly the day I checked out. Around 11am I saw the maid near my room and when she asked, I told her I would be out of the room soon so she could take care of it. Everyday she had been in there to replace the towels and make the bed. I gathered all of my belongings and took them down to the lobby in a few trips. On my last trip down the stairs the maid was by the door and we exchanged pleasant farewells, and she entered the room to begin cleaning. The checkout process took about 10 min and then the woman at the front desk called a taxi for me upon my request. About 15-20 minutes went by as I waited for the taxi to arrive. Nobody on the hotel staff approached me or acted as if there were any problems. My taxi came, I left for my new apartment. The next afternoon I got a voicemail on my cell phone. It was the nice woman who owns Hotel Occidental. Apparently I left red ink stains on the carpet of my room. Due to this, they took the liberty of charging $300 to my Visa card that was used to pay for the room!!! I immediately went back to the hotel to address the matter. I explained that I had no red pens, markers or anything else that would have caused this damage. I assured them that before leaving the room I looked it over and there were no damages whatsoever. The owner and Ms. Mendoza (who ironically enough posted her own comments on this site the same day as my departure) would not believe that these damages were caused by me. They told me "You were the last one in this room, these stains weren't here before you stayed. Someone has to pay for this damage." It was too bad that neither of them could explain to me why I wasn't stopped and shown these stains before I left the property the previous day. Not knowing the laws and my rights, I nervously told them I would be disputing this charge with Visa and they told me "That's fine, but we already charged the credit card and we're getting our money." For nearly 3 months I have had this $300 charge in dispute on my credit card. It caused me a great amount of undue stress. I truly believe the Owner and "Project Manager" of this hotel are trying to take advantage of people to make this new hotel successful. Being a young person they thought they could take advantage of me. They got away with overcharging me on the room. I could accept that. Lying about stains and committing fraud is inexcusable though. Now that Visa has confirmed this was illegal activity, I will be reporting this hotel to the BBB. Don't be surprised if you stay at Hotel Occidental and are told "I'm sorry, we can't accept Visa" In closing, if you decide to stay at the Hotel Occidental, be sure to inspect your room thoroughly upon check-in. When it is check-out time, request a member of management come to your room and inspect it with you. If they did it to me, they could do it to you just as easy. I don't want anyone else having to go through what I did. This was by far my worst experience EVER at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “To stay or not to stay...let me give you reasons for both”
Reviews.Author: simpleutahboi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Occidental is a new, immaculately clean hybrid of hostel and hotel suite. My review will cover only the single bed room, with shared bath. There are other options available, including private bath for a higher rate. WHY I WOULD STAY HERE 1. Very affordable. Being so close to downtown San Diego (zoo, balboa park, etc.) you would think it would be impossible to find a clean, quality room under $100, but this hotel proves it can be done. I booked in advance and paid only $70 during a San Diego Pride (a huge city event!). 2. It's extremely clean and well kept. Daily maid service is included for rooms as well as common areas and baths. 3. Even the single rooms had MOST of the basic amenities (cable TV, internet, free local calls, desk) but it also included a kitchenette with dishes for two, a microwave and a mini-fridge. 4. Great for socializing and meeting other people in the common areas (patio and lobby). However, since guests seem to be budget-conscious, the social aspect may appeal only to a 20s/30s age group. WHY I WOULD NOT STAY HERE 1. This is not a hotel for luxury. Even though it provides the basic amenities that most hotels provide, it is very basic. No luxurious linens, no fancy decor. In fact, once you make it past the front desk, you will feel like you are in a newly built college-dorm. Very plainly decorated, steel doors for each room, etc. No irons in rooms, although you can ask for one at the front desk (but no ironing board). 2. There were only two showers available for 25 rooms on the first floor. There were 6 "waterclosets" also (just a toilet in a small closet-type room with hand santizer). Don't misunderstand, these were all VERY clean. I mention it only because it can be surprising if you have never stayed in a situation like this. 3. The internet connection, even though it existed both as a data line and wireless, was horrible. It dropped a connection every few minutes, making instant messaging, listening to music, etc. nearly impossible. I over-heard other guests making similar comments. 4. Front-desk staff was less than helpful. I had parked in a pay parking lot ($7 a day) and asked the front desk if there were other less expensive or free parking lots nearby. She said, "oh, well, they are just around...you just have to look for them." For the most part, this reflected the staff's willingness to help guests. 5. Bring earplugs!! The hotel is located directly underneath the landing path of commercial airline traffic just as they are about to land. Although air-traffic is minimal at night, you won't be taking a nap or sleeping in without earplugs. 6. While I haven't see the two-bed rooms, I can't imagine staying in a one-bed room with more than 2 adults. Even 2 adults and a small child would be too many. This is not an establishment for children. OVERALL If you are coming to San Diego on a budget or plan on actually going out and EXPERIENCING San , then this hotel is an excellent option. It's very new, clean, economical (you can buy food, keep it and prepare it in your room and save $$$) and comfortable if you don't need to be pampered. However, if you are traveling with a family, want an exercise room, swimming pool, dependable high speed internet connection, concierge service, etc., then this is probably not for you I should point out that the website photos and information on the hotel are very accurate and can be used as a good description and guide.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis amongst monolithic Luxury hotels”
Reviews.Author: samsen
Reviews.Content: I just checked out today from the Hotel Occidental and had a great time. I travel frequently to San Diego on business and although born and raised in San Diego, I often have difficulty pouring hard earned money into the larger monolithic hotel chains. In this case, the city was near capacity. I happened upon the Occidental and was surprised to have a private shower and komode when I had booked a shared bathroom. The Hotel exudes elegance and charm! The interior decorator cleverly captured the era of the hotel by hanging art work of snapshots in San Diego history. I was especially impressed with the posters of 1916 and 1935 California Pacific Exposition showing some of the decades old Balboa Park architecture (Still standing, left over from the state expo). The room was simple, but the amenities had been thoughtfully planned out: A mini-kitchen including refrigerator and microwave...and best of all a DVD player built into the TV. This room is only what college freshmans dream about. High tech in design, but comfortable. A great, quiet location that is 2 blocks from almost every cultural and recreational activity. Undoubtably, the Hotel Occidental will be my home away from home address for future stays. A true destination hotel with real international appeal. If you are tired of over-rated five star oppulence and want to live like a local with a comfy (Glad to be back home) feeling, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great FIND!”
Reviews.Author: foxglove10
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about staying in a European-style hotel with some shared bathroom and shower facilities, but I have to say this was a great little hotel with a charming feel and a wonderfully helpful and accommodating staff. The amenities are quite nice - each room has a microwave and refrigerator. Some rooms have a WC (just a toilet) and some have a full shower - you pay a little more for them. When they say "shared showers," I initially had visions of gym class in high school, but these are private showers, one person at a time - it's just that you may have to wait your turn, just as if you were staying in a home. My travelling companion has travelled extensively in Europe, and she assured me this was exactly like those, only cleaner. The housekeeping staff is amazing - the guy who said there was no maid service must have had a Do Not Disturb sign out or something, because our room was spotless every time we returned to it. We loved the fact that breakfast was set up every day from 7am until 11am, and it was much better than the usual hour-long 7:30am - 8:30am continental quickie offered in so-called "upper level" hotels. The later end time allowed us to truly enjoy our VACATION by sleeping in, rather than getting up as early as if I were at home, dressing and rushing out to grab a stale croissant and coffee, like other places we've stayed, resulting in needing a protein fix an hour or two later. Here, breakfast is fresh fruits, fresh danish and croissants, muffins, cereal and milk, orange juice, coffee - a nice spread offering a breakfast of some substance. They also have a nice laundry facility if you need to wash some clothes during your stay. Lisa, Giselle, Ricardo, and Lauren were all very attentive to our every need, had great suggestions for us, gave us directions when we needed them, and were generally great. There was a little snafu with our reservation the first night, but we dealt with it and were upgraded to a nicer room for the remainder of our stay (although the first room wasn't really bad - it just lacked a private shower, and this turned out to be no problem). Upon checkout, we found we'd been comped the lower price for all four nights of our stay - we didn't ask, nor expect this, the staff simply did it for us as an apology and a thank you. The one negative thing I could say is that there's not a lot of parking on the property, but the offset is that there is a ton of residential parking nearby, which is free. Downtown, Gaslamp, the Convention Center, loads of restaurants, Balboa Park, and the Zoo are all in walking distance if you're fit, or short cab ride if you prefer an easier pace. Simply put, the Hotel Occidental offers a lot of value for your money. And I didn't even mention the bikes you can borrow. I'd say a lot more positive stuff, but I'm afraid I've already done too much - once everybody figures out that this place is there, I think booking a room is going to get a little tougher. It's a great find in a crowded vacation spot!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Occidental
HotelInfo.Address: 410 Elm Street, San Diego, CA 92101
